    • Projects

      • Dang Ol' Weather (Dang ol' Weather)

        • A Group project written over about a week, utilizing OpenWeatherMap and Google Maps auto-complete Apis in order to allow the user to check the weather.

        • Users can input a US city to get the local weather, a five day forecast, and an associated quote from King of the Hill's Boomhauer.

        • Our first usage and implementation of Tailwind CSS and associated component UI libraries, both of which were explorations of new technology, rather than requirements for the app itself.

        • Technology Used: Typescript, Tailwind, Javascript, Cypress

      • Tracker (Tracker)

        • A job tracking CRM tool designed to allow users to keep track of job applications, store contact information, and find companies to apply to.

        • I primarily worked on the front end of this project, helping implement a style guide, creating menu bars for desktop and mobile, and implementing accessibility features.

        • This project allowed me to hone my skills with Typescript and Tailwind, using these tools to create something far more complex than the above application, while also pushing me to do so that adhered to the style guide created beforehand.

        • Technologies used: Typescript, Tailwind, JavaScript, Cypress

      • Poke-Gochi (Poke-Gochi)

        • Interactive app where users can interact, train, and level up virtual Pokémon, this group project was written over the course of a 10-day sprint.

        • I was part the overall project design, helping to conceptualize how the application would work, and took part in many front-end tasks as well, including layout, visual design, and navigation.

        • This was my first time implementing modals, and integrating them into a webpage. I also ensured that the page's design would fit nearly any desktop screen layout. Neither of these were required parts of the project, but they were very interesting to learn about!

        • Technology Used: Cypress, JavaScript, CSS, Router
